business.headline: Ambanis retain crown as India's most valuable family business in 2025Mukesh Ambani leads Reliance Industries Limited, which has roots in the energy sector but also has major operations in retail and digital services. Founded in 1957 by Dhirubhai Ambani, the company is now managed by the second generation and continues to be a key force in India's economy.

Sebi rejects Anil Ambani's plea in Yes Bank case, ED probe continues: ReportThe case relates to investments worth Rs 21,500 crore made by Reliance Mutual Fund, then owned by Anil Ambani, in Yes Bank's additional tier-1 (AT-1) bonds between 2016 and 2019.

Retail inflation eases to 8-year low of 1.55% in JulyRetail inflation declined to an 8-year low in July 2025 as food prices plunged sharply. Both rural and urban areas experienced deflation in food prices, with rural food inflation at -1.74% and urban at -1.90%.
Sensex ends 368 points lower, Nifty below 24,500; Maruti down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 368.49 points to end at 80,235.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 97.65 points to close at 24,487.40.
RBI's job gets tougher, thanks to 50% US tariffsRBI kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% and warned that US tariffs and global supply issues could quickly change the outlook.

SIPs for the win: How Trump tariffs shook D-Street but boosted mutual fundsMutual funds are seeing record inflows even as markets struggle. Are SIP investors spotting an opportunity the rest are missing, or is it just faith in long-term discipline?
India bans land imports of more Bangladesh jute productsEarlier on June 27, India prohibited imports of a number of jute products and woven fabrics from Bangladesh through all land routes.

5 SIP myths that hurt investors more than markets, explains stock market expertMany investors blame market volatility for poor returns, but often, it's the myths they believe about SIPs that do more harm. Here's what an expert reveals.

How to repay a Rs 1 crore home loan in under 10 years and save Rs 52 lakhThe joy of getting the keys to your home is unmatched, but the reality of a 20-year (or longer) home loan often brings with it a heavy financial commitment.

Trump tariffs could worsen India's affordable housing crisis. Here's howDonald Trump's steep tariffs on Indian exports risk inflating construction costs, squeezing developers, and pushing affordable housing further out of reach for millions already struggling in India's overheated property market

New and old income tax regimes explained as ITR filing deadline extendedFor FY 2024-25, the new tax regime is automatically applied to taxpayers. Salaried individuals can still choose the old regime while filing their return, but if you miss the due date and file a belated ITR, it can only be done under the new regime.

Field notes from building a billion-dollar luxury brandDiverse leadership isn't just good business, it's the future blueprint for luxury real estate success. Parisa Seif, Managing Partner at Kleindienst Group, writes

entertainment.headline: Did Aamir Khan charge Rs 20 crore for Rajinikanth's Coolie? Here's the truthAs opposed to the viral reports, actor Aamir Khan is not charging anything for his brief role in 'Coolie'. The actor is playing a negative role in the Lokesh Kanagaraj directorial.

From art to mass appeal: Are the National Awards losing relevance? Experts answerNational Awards are facing criticism for favouring commercial blockbusters over indie films. Experts question if the awards still hold their original relevance in today's social media age.

The Nice Guy review: Lee Dong-wook's drama is slow, sweet, and strikingly relevantRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025The Nice Guy Kdrama review: The Lee Dong-wook starrer offers a slow, heartfelt take on the gangster drama genre. It highlights the struggles of family duty and dreams amid harsh realities.

Jennifer Aniston says media coverage of her divorce with Brad Pitt was shamefulActor Jennifer Aniston recently recalled how she was affected by the media scrutiny during her divorce from actor Brad Pitt. She also reflected on how celebrities struggle for privacy when it comes to their personal lives.

Saiyaara OTT release: When and where to watch Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda filmSaiyaara, which is currently running in theatres, will premiere on OTT in a month's time. The Mohir Suri directorial, starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, released in theatres on July 18.

39 years after Baghwaan Dada, Hrithik and Rajinikanth to clash at box officeWith Hrithik Roshan's 'War 2' and Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' clashing at the box office, fans recalled the time when Roshan shared screen space with the veteran actor in 'Bhagwaan Dada (1986).

Coolie cast fee: What Rajinikanth, Aamir Khan and Lokesh Kanagaraj earnedAs advance bookings for 'Coolie' soar worldwide, here's a peek at what the members of the film, including director Lokesh Kanagaraj and Superstar Rajinikanth, earned for their contribution to the film.

Kartik Aaryan to play Air Force pilot in Shimit Amin's film Captain India: ReportActor Kartik Aaryan is reportedly set to collaborate with 'Chak De India' director Shimit Amin. He will play the role of an Air Force pilot in the film titled 'Captain India'. Filming will begin in 2026 with locations in India and Morocco.

Channing Tatum joins Demon Slayer Infinity Castle English voice cast Hollywood actor Channing Tatum and voice actor Rebecca Wang join the English dub cast of 'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Movie: Infinity Castle', the next chapter in the record-breaking anime saga. The film premieres in Japan in July 2025.

When Kamal Haasan said no to Main Hoon Na with a polite 'duck off' to Farah KhanFilmmaker Farah Khan shared that Kamal Haasan refused a role in her debut film 'Main Hoon Na'. She recalled travelling to Chennai to narrate the script. The role eventually went to actor Suniel Shetty.

A Gen-Z review of Sholay: 50 years later, still a total vibeRevisiting Bollywood classic Sholay through a Gen-Z lens: Basanti's feminist flair, Jai-Veeru's ultimate friendship goals, Gabbar's meme-worthy villainy, and Thakur's poetic revenge.

The Recruit's Noah Centineo to play young John Rambo in prequel: ReportActor Noah Centineo is set to feature in the upcoming 'John Rambo' origin film directed by Jalmari Helander. The project aims to reboot the iconic franchise with a fresh take on Rambo's early years during the Vietnam War.

Rupali Ganguly reacts to top court order: Care for stray dogs, don't exile themRupali Ganguly has urged compassion as the Supreme Court mandates the relocation of stray dogs in Delhi and the NCR to address rising incidents of dog bites and rabies.

Param Sundari trailer: Fun, romance and Rajinikanth in Janhvi-Sidharth's love storyThe much-awaited trailer for 'Param Sundari' featuring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor has released. Directed by Dinesh Vijan, 'Param Sundari' will release in theatres on August 29.

Dogs are Delhiites too: John Abraham to Chief Justice over court order on straysActor John Abraham wrote a letter to Chief Justice BR Gavai, urging the court to review its order on stray dogs in Delhi. The actor also cited the World Health Organisation in his letter.

Rajinikanth called out for body-shaming Coolie co-stars Soubin Shahir, Aamir KhanSuperstar Rajinikanth delivered a 41-minute speech at the 'Coolie' audio launch. However, he was criticised for calling Aamir Khan 'short' and Soubin Shahir 'bald'.

Bollywood slams top court's order to move dogs to sheltersBollywood stars have opposed the Supreme Court's order against stray dogs. Actors like Janhvi Kapoor and Varun Dhawan say, "Just no compassion left."

KBC 17: Officers Sofiya Qureshi, Vyomika Singh recount Operation Sindoor with Big BActor Amitabh Bachchan welcomed Col Sofiya Qureshi, Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Commander Prerna Deosthalee in 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. The upcoming episode has been shot as an Independence Day special.

Hip-hop duo Seedhe Maut approached for Bigg Boss 19: SourceThe makers of the much-awaited reality show 'Bigg Boss 19' have reportedly approached hip-hop duo Seedhe Maut. Having delivered songs like 'Raat Ki Rani' and 'Khatta Flow', Siddhant Sharma and Abhijay Negi have a massive fan following amongst Gen Z.

general news.headline: Government asks Air India, IndiGo to resume flights to China by next month: ReportResumption of direct flights between India and China, suspended since the COVID-19 pandemic, hints at thawing of tensions between the two nations.

Poll panel correct, Aadhaar can't be accepted as citizenship proof: Top courtThe Supreme Court backed the Election Commission's stand that Aadhaar is not proof of citizenship, as petitioners challenged Bihar's voter roll revision, citing mass exclusions.

Retail inflation eases to 8-year low of 1.55% in JulyRetail inflation declined to an 8-year low in July 2025 as food prices plunged sharply. Both rural and urban areas experienced deflation in food prices, with rural food inflation at -1.74% and urban at -1.90%.

Pak threatens India, world as a nuclear state. Does it have the bite to match its bark?India has 180 warheads while Pakistan has 170, according to Stockholm International Peace Research Institute data. Incidentally, Pakistan does not have sea-based nuclear weapons.

From Rs 30,000 to Rs 3,000, India's weight-loss game is changing. What's the catch?With anti-obesity drugs like semaglutide set to drop in price from a staggering Rs 30,000 to just Rs 3,000 per month, millions of Indians battling weight issues could finally gain access to life-changing treatment.

No action against owners of Delhi's old vehicles until next hearing: Supreme CourtA Supreme Court bench on Tuesday ordered that no coercive steps be taken against owners of diesel vehicles over 10 years old and petrol vehicles over 15 years old in Delhi-NCR, until further orders.

Dogs are Delhiites too: John Abraham to Chief Justice over court order on straysActor John Abraham wrote a letter to Chief Justice BR Gavai, urging the court to review its order on stray dogs in Delhi. The actor also cited the World Health Organisation in his letter.

70-year-old Sikh man in US thrashed with golf club near gurdwara, criticalA 70-year-old Sikh man was brutally attacked with a golf club near a gurdwara in North Hollywood, Los Angeles. He was critically injured and has undergone three surgeries. The Sikh community has sought increased police cover in the area. No arrests have yet been made in connection with the attack.

What happens to Z+ security of leaders after they are detained, arrested?Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, along with other opposition members, was detained by police during his protest. Rahul has a Z+ security cover provided by CAPF personnel. What do the personnel of the paramilitary forces do when the leaders they are protecting are arrested? Till where do they extend their security cover?

Overcrowded, dirty: What visit to Delhi's dog centres reveals after court orderFollowing the Supreme Court's order to remove and shelter stray dogs, India Today visited two MCD-run sterilisation centres in Delhi, uncovering poor hygiene, overcrowding, and serious operational lapses.

Cruel, shortsighted: Rahul Gandhi slams Supreme Court's order on stray dogsRahul Gandhi on Tuesday joined a chorus of voices opposing the Supreme Court's order to round up and permanently relocate all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR, calling blanket removals "cruel, shortsighted".
Field Marshal Asim Munir's Armageddon rantThe Pakistan Army chief has transformed himself into a vile, windbag provocateur threatening nuclear weapons use. Here's why the world must worry.

Their unstable love-hate saga teeters on mistrust, power plays, and fleeting alliances. We revisit this rom-com with a series of scandalous stories.

Most spoilt woman: Kangana Ranaut reacts to video of Jaya Bachchan pushing manKangana Ranaut's reaction came after Jaya Bachchan was seen pushing and scolding a man who was trying to click a selfie with her.

In terror tag for Baloch group, Trump largesse for Pak. Message for India?While the Balochistan Liberation Army has been behind several attacks in Pakistan, particularly targeting its military, what is significant here is the timing of the US announcement.

What Pakistan army chief Asim Munir's nuclear threat to India from American soil indicatesIndia vowed not to give in to Pakistan's nuclear blackmail and said it was "regrettable" that the "nuclear sabre-rattling" had come from the soil of a friendly third country

Where have Gurugram's gurgling river, green hills gone?Gurugram's rise as a corporate powerhouse has come at the expense of its rivers, wetlands, and the Aravallis that once sustained it. The Sahibi River, the Aravallis, and their forests are now either gone or in a dire state. The city's recurring floods, choking dust, and vanishing green cover are the direct fallout of decades of unchecked, ill-planned "development", which, in effect, have been the reasons for their disappearance.

Sophia Dunkley was adjudged Women's Player of the Month for her stellar show against India.

China plans railway line to India's doorsteps, sparks twin concernChina is set to build a massive railway line linking Tibet and northwestern Xinjiang, which reports say will pass near the LAC with India. Beijing's rail push, right through India's Aksai Chin, is expected to add to New Delhi's concerns. Beijing is planning a rail network up to the Nepal border, and the sensitive Chumbi Valley, the area of the 2017 Doklam stand-off.

sports.headline: Dewald Brevis' 125 powers South Africa to series-leveling win vs AustraliaSouth Africa kept the three-match T20I series alive with a commanding 53-run victory over Australia in Darwin, courtesy of a scintillating century from Dewald Brevis and a disciplined all-round bowling performance.

Monica Seles reveals battle with myasthenia gravis, a neuromuscular diseaseMonica Seles has revealed she was diagnosed three years ago with myasthenia gravis, a chronic neuromuscular disease, and is speaking publicly for the first time to raise awareness ahead of the US Open.

Test cricket a hit: Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy breaks digital viewership recordsThe England-India five-match Test series set a new digital viewership benchmark with over 170 million viewers. India leveled the series by winning a dramatic fifth Test on the final day at The Oval, London.

Watch: Rohit Sharma flaunts his stunning new Lamborghini on Mumbai roadsIndia's ODI captain Rohit Sharma was seen driving his brand new Lamborghini on the roads of Mumbai, making fans turn their heads.

National Sports Bill will end stagnation, bring in transparency: PT UshaIOA President and Rajya Sabha MP PT Usha on Tuesday backed the National Sports Governance Bill, calling it a step to end decades of "stagnant status quo" and bring "transparency and accountability" to Indian sports administration.

Dewald Brevis shatters India batter's record with 125: Stat PackAUS vs SA, 2nd T20I: Young batter Dewald Brevis smashed an unbeaten 125 off 56 balls to power South Africa to 218 for seven in the second T20I at the Marrara Cricket Ground in Darwin.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
